text: <@U04688R39TN> Hey there, there is no time limit for accessing a custom object. Can you kindly put more light on your queries or issues ?

hey all!

I am trying to create a new form that will a lot of conditional fields depending on which dropdown option is chosen in option 1... Is there a way to set conditionals on an image? For instance, if the user clicks "I'd like to... [get account support]" , the next generated content should be an image, and text saying, "Please contact us at "<tel:1234567890|123-456-7890>" for additional help.

I feel so limited right now

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.
Yeah honestly without building out the form with a good amount of custom code it's going to be pretty tricky to do this with a default form, conditionals only work with fields right now
<@U01QVR44MEY> How would I go about the custom code route? The end goal is to embed this HS form on a client site
So here's some docs on customizing the embed code, <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>

But there's also the option of building the form completely custom (HTML, CSS, JS) and then submitting it using the form submit endpoint <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
Definitely a little deep in the weeds, and if you aren't a developer or don't have access to a developer it will definitely be a bit tricky

Im a developer but dont have a lot of experience with custom embeds like this -- im sure i can figure it out :slightly_smiling_face: Didnt read into your links yet, but is there a design system I can import? Or im custom styling as well
So the design will be pulled in if you are using the first approach, just customizing the embed code. If you're using the second approach though (completely custom), you'll be writing your own css.
Let me know if you run into any issues
<@U01QVR44MEY> I think I'll need to go fully custom since i cant show/hide the necessary fields
<@U01QVR44MEY> Is this something that could also work? Or am i better off still making a custom one: <http://fillout.com/integrations/HubSpot|fillout.com/integrations/HubSpot>
Yeah fillout has picture choice questions that you could create conditionals on

Mainly the goal is to have a CTA block stating the user has to go elsewhere to get support/more info , the image part is moreso decorative... this is an example structue :

[image]
[text telling where the user needs to go next]
[maybe a button or two linking to another part of the site]
so the image will be shown no matter what?
Fillout definitely isn't the best option for CTA type forms
only if a certain option is chosen, that block of content appears
ah understood
Yeah you can definitely use Fillout just understand that it's obviously not as well connected to HubSpot for things like form views, particular fills etc
these are the specific use cases
and we would want to classify these responses into certain lists depending on what they filled out
Yeah I mean I really don't see why you would want to do this in a form
you're not collecting any information
You're just routing people
I would personally just write it custom
but that's my take
right , for two of the 8 options, other options capture content
then probably use fillout
okay i will try that :slightly_smiling_face: That link you sent with the onSubmit content, is that it for connecting to HS? Or are there other references i have to include
Yeah that's all you need to submit the info to HubSpot
:man-shrugging::skin-tone-2: , it's a pretty strange use case, sorry I couldn't be more helpful

no no youre fine! Youre helping me justify custom coding this haha.

Just need to actually do it now :sob:
hahaha, np
This was for access to the custom objects schema scope in a public app, as that is not publicly available. This is now resolved through the HubSpot Community Forum. Had to apply for the access.
